abstracts.cdata!:
This report on the project's
            performance in developing pastoral cooperative associations
            (PCAs), reviews their development, current position, and the
            issues arising in their continued evolution two years after
            project closing. While the project succeeded in establishing
            the PCAs, it was inconsistent over time in its approach to
            the organizations. As a result, the PCAs have not developed
            a clear role and consequent visibility, either locally or
            nationally, and risk becoming insignificant. Given the
            marginality of pastoral livestock producers and their need
            to integrate into the larger economy, this is increasing
            frustration and could undercut other efforts, including
            those of successor projects, unless the lessons learned from
            the project's efforts to support pastoralists are
            heeded. First, instead of a misplaced emphasis on resource
            management systems that attempts to devise and introduce
            improved technologies, priority should be given to actions
            that will help the pastoralists better integrate into the
            larger economy and society. Second future projects should
            consider actions that will foster the growth of a broader
            pattern of local leadership in the communities, actions
            providing an enabling environment for new initiatives and
            the emergence of new cooperative groupings. Third when
            strong local structures for development-oriented activities
            do not exist, a sequenced and process approach to project
            operations is required.

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Second Livestock Project in Mauritania.
            The main project objectives were to slow the deterioration
            of grazing areas and boost livestock productivity by the
            following means: (i) making groups of pastoralists
            responsible for allocated grazing areas; (ii) providing
            better extension services and production inputs; and (iii)
            contributing to the store of knowledge of livestock
            production systems in order to help formulate a development
            policy and plan future interventions in the sector.
            Bank's performance was not satisfactory.
            Borrower's performance was not satisfactory. The main
            lessons learned from the project are the following: (i)
            tapping a community's organizational capacity and
            commitment to decision-making has proven extremely
            effective, and hilds promise for the future; (ii) project
            design should always be kept simple, and when problems are
            encountered during implementation, restructuring should aim
            to simplify even more; and (iii) no project of this sort
            should be attempted unless a comprehensive government
            implementation plan has been drawn up and relevant
            monitoring indicators have been identified.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Livestock Project for
            Mauritania seeks to slow the deterioration of the grazing
            areas and to boost productivity by:  (i) making groups of
            pastoralists responsible for allocated grazing areas, (ii)
            providing better services and production inputs, and (iii)
            increasing the knowledge of livestock production systems
            essential to the formulation of a development policy and to
            the planning of future interventions. Main project
            components are: (a) a pilot component for the establishment
            of pastoral cooperative associations; (b) the study of
            livestock production systems, project monitoring and the
            preparation of projects; (c) distribution of production
            inputs for sale to livestock owners; (d) strengthening of
            livestock services; (e) establishment of a Livestock Fund
            and a production improvement fund; and (f) construction of a
            small abattoir in Nouakchott.
